intro: Antennaria nebrascensis, commonly known as the Nebraska mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It is a low-growing perennial that produces numerous small flower heads, which attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
